keyword: how many calories in gin and tonic water
title: How Many Calories in Gin and Tonic?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in gin and tonic water for a standard serving, including carbs, sugars, and nutrition tweaks for lighter options.
h1: How Many Calories in Gin and Tonic?
assumptions: Standard serving: 1.5 fl oz gin (80 proof), 4 fl oz tonic water, no lime or extras.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by gin brand, proof, tonic type, serving size, and mixers. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard gin and tonic has about 138 calories, primarily from alcohol and tonic sugar.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a standard gin and tonic?
faqs.a: About 138 calories for 1.5 oz gin and 4 oz tonic water.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in gin and tonic water?
faqs.a: Yes, around 10.3 g carbs from the tonic's sugars; gin adds none.

faqs.q: How to make a low-calorie gin and tonic?
faqs.a: Swap regular tonic for diet or zero-sugar version to drop to ~97 kcal.
Yes, 1.5 oz of 80-proof gin has ~97 kcal, all from alcohol.

faqs.q: What about sodium in gin and tonic?
faqs.a: Low at ~12 mg per serving, mostly from the tonic water.
